required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Interventional Study (NIS) In Patients With Advanced And/Or Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (mRCC) Treated With SUTENT®
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional Study In Patients With Advanced And/Or Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma (mRCC) Treated With SUTENT®

brief_summary.textblock: Primary objective: to increase knowledge about safety, tolerability, quality of life and efficacy under conditions of routine use of SUTENT®. Secondary objectives: treatment response, hypothyroidism prevalence.The efficacy will be assessed using the Objective Response Rate, Time to Progression based on the RECIST criteria and the ECOG performance data.

detailed_description.textblock: 180 patients will be enrolled at 20 key oncological centres, the sample size is sufficient for exploratory analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR). CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: The period from study entry until disease progression, death, or date of last contact.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (up to 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: OS is the duration from enrollment to death.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Month 3
primary_outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Month 6
primary_outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Month 9
primary_outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Month 12
primary_outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Sunitinib-induced Hypertension and Tumor Response to Treatment (PFS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of first documentation of response to treatment (up to 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension was determined using blood pressure recorded at each postbaseline visit. Once participants were identified as having sunitinib-induced hypertension, they retained that status at subsequent visits. PFS is the time from start of study treatment to first documentation of tumor response to treatment. Hazard ratio represents the relationship between sunitinib-induced hypertension and PFS (presence/absence of hypertension).

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Sunitinib-induced Hypertension and Tumor Response to Treatment (OS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of death (up to 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension was determined using blood pressure recorded at each postbaseline visit. Once participants were identified as having sunitinib-induced hypertension, they retained that status at subsequent visits. OS is the time from start of study treatment to death. Hazard ratio represents the relationship between sunitinib-induced hypertension and OS.
TSH and FT4 levels were measured and hypothyroidism was defined as a TSH level >5.0 mIU/L at that time point.

Hypertension was defined as follows. Grade 1: Asymptomatic, transient (less than [<]24 hours) increase by >20mm Hg (diastolic) or to >150/100 mm Hg if previously within normal limits (WNL). Grade 2: Recurrent or persistent (24 hours or more) or symptomatic increase by >20 mm Hg (diastolic) or to >150/100 mm Hg if previously WNL. Grade 3: Requiring >1 drug or more intensive therapy than previously. Grade 4: Life-threatening. Grade 5: Death.

other_outcome.measure: Summary of Adverse Events for Participants Who Required Dose Modification
other_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) or treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. Study drug modifications included reduced dose or temporary discontinuation of treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Hypertension, by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Grade
other_outcome.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension: not present at baseline but developed through the study, or if present at baseline increased by more than (>) 20% during the study. Grade 1: Asymptomatic, transient (less than [<]24 hours) increase by >20 millimeters of Mercury (mm Hg) (diastolic) or to >150/100 mm Hg if previously within normal limits (WNL); Grade 2: Recurrent or persistent (>=24 hours) or symptomatic increase by >20 mm Hg (diastolic) or to >150/100 mm Hg if previously WNL; Grade 3: Requiring >1 drug or more intensive therapy than previously; Grade 4: Life-threatening; Grade 5: Death.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Responding to Treatment
other_outcome.description: Response categories for target lesions: Complete response (CR): Disappearance of all target lesions; Partial response (PR): At least a 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions, reference=baseline sum of longest dimensions; Progressive disease (PD): At least a 20% increase in the sum of the longest dimensions, or the appearance of 1 or more new lesions; Stable disease (SD): Not sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR, not sufficient increase to qualify for PD; Reference for PD and SD: smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment started.

arm_group.description: Patients with metastatic or advanced renal cell carcinoma after failure of cytokines therapy.

intervention.description: SUTENT® hard gelatin capsules containing 12.5 mg, 25 mg or 50 mg equivalent of sunitinib malate; daily dosage of 50 mg for 4 consecutive weeks followed by a 2-week rest period. Sutent is administered until disease progression or occurrence of unacceptable toxicity.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with metastatic and/or advanced renal cell carcinoma after failure of cytokines therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No previous cytokines therapy.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Safety and tolerability of SUTENT® in patients with metastatic or advanced renal cell carcinoma after failure of cytokines in real-life setting.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: The use and dosage recommendations for Sunitinib (Sutent) were in accordance with the local Summary of Product Characteristics.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: The use and dosage recommendations for Sunitinib (Sutent) were in accordance with the local Summary of Product Characteristics.

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender
Involvement of Regional Lymph Nodes
measure.description: The sum of participants may not be equal to the number of participants beginning the study. A participant may be included in more than one category, or a participant may not be included in any category.

measure.title: Previous Anti-Tumor Therapy
measure.description: The sum of participants may not be equal to the number of participants beginning the study. A participant may be included in more than one category, or a participant may not be included in any category.

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: ECOG criteria: 0: Fully active. 1: Ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of all selfcare. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, no selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead.

measure.title: Frequency of Involved Disease Sites
measure.description: The sum of participants may not be equal to the number of participants beginning the study. A participant may be included in more than one category, or a participant may not be included in any category.

measure.title: Prevalence of hypothyroidism
measure.description: At baseline, participants were considered hypothyroid if the investigator indicated they had hypothyroidism (yes/no) on the case report form (CRF). At subsequent visits, thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) and free thyroxine (FT4) levels were measured and hypothyroidism was defined as a TSH level greater than (>)5.0 milli-International Units per liter (mIU/L) at that visit.

measure.title: Prevalence of Hypertension
measure.description: Hypertension was defined as blood pressure >140/90 millimeters of Mercury (mm Hg). At baseline, presence/absence of hypertension was recorded. If either the presence/absence of hypertension question or the blood pressure at Baseline indicated that the participant currently had hypertension, then the participant was considered to have hypertension at baseline. At subsequent visits, hypertension status was determined in terms of the blood pressure recorded at that visit.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR). CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR is defined as at least 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): all participants who received at least one dose of the study medication.

measurement_list.measurement: NA=not available. No median available, very few deaths observed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status at Week 6
outcome.description: Following are ECOG grades. 0: Fully active, perform all pre-disease activities without restriction. 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, carry out work of a light or sedentary nature. 2: Ambulatory, capable of selfcare, unable to carry out any work activities, up and about more than (>) 50% of waking hours. 3: Capable of limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair >50% of waking hours. 4: Completely disabled, not capable of any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair. 5: Dead. Participants in "Not reported" category were on study, had no data for this time point.
outcome.population: FAS. Percentages based on entire FAS population.

outcome.title: Correlation Between Sunitinib-induced Hypertension and Tumor Response to Treatment (PFS)
outcome.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension was determined using blood pressure recorded at each postbaseline visit. Once participants were identified as having sunitinib-induced hypertension, they retained that status at subsequent visits. PFS is the time from start of study treatment to first documentation of tumor response to treatment. Hazard ratio represents the relationship between sunitinib-induced hypertension and PFS (presence/absence of hypertension).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to date of first documentation of response to treatment (up to 12 months)

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: The use and dosage recommendations for Sunitinib (Sutent) were in accordance with the local Summary of Product Characteristics.

measure.title: Correlation Between Sunitinib-induced Hypertension and Tumor Response to Treatment (PFS)
measure.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension was determined using blood pressure recorded at each postbaseline visit. Once participants were identified as having sunitinib-induced hypertension, they retained that status at subsequent visits. PFS is the time from start of study treatment to first documentation of tumor response to treatment. Hazard ratio represents the relationship between sunitinib-induced hypertension and PFS (presence/absence of hypertension).

analysis.groups_desc: Time to PFS was analyzed using survival analysis methodology. Model was fitted with sunitinib-induced hypertension included as a time-dependent covariate (presence versus absence of hypertension).

outcome.title: Correlation Between Sunitinib-induced Hypertension and Tumor Response to Treatment (OS)
outcome.description: Sunitinib-induced hypertension was determined using blood pressure recorded at each postbaseline visit. Once participants were identified as having sunitinib-induced hypertension, they retained that status at subsequent visits. OS is the time from start of study treatment to death. Hazard ratio represents the relationship between sunitinib-induced hypertension and OS.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Hypothyroidism
outcome.description: TSH and FT4 levels were measured and hypothyroidism was defined as a TSH level >5.0 mIU/L at that time point.
outcome.population: FAS. n = number of participants with evaluable data at that time point.

outcome.title: Summary of Adverse Events for Participants Who Required Dose Modification
outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) or treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) were defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. Study drug modifications included reduced dose or temporary discontinuation of treatment.
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = All participants who required dose modification because of an adverse event. The total number of participants may exceed the number of participants analyzed because one participant may have reported more than one adverse event.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: The use and dosage recommendations for Sunitinib (Sutent) were in accordance with the local Summary of Product Characteristics.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
